column4: Anyone else having trouble with pairing bluetooth devices with a 0000 pin?
That's the thing... I cannot enter a key in ubuntu 8.10. There is no way to do it.
i just sent my pc a file and i was asked for pairing. never set a thing myself
There is a bug filed for this on launchpad.. but not gettin much attention and is a serious problem for me..
This only happens with certain devices that want a 0000 pin.
i have no file called pin at /etc/bluetooth/
I also have no file called /etc/bluetooth/hcid.conf
read that guide and i think it tells you how to populate the file
Why is bluetooth such a pian to setup in ubuntu? I just switched from windows and did not have to do any of this.
So i just make a file called hcid.conf and put : Passkey"0000"; in it
try firing up bluez or whatever gnome uses
